_header: The owl to the stone and the stone to the owl

BodRawD328.Transcription:
the owle to þe stone and þe stone to þe owlebut euer a
                    bydyth þe sely owle
BodRawD328.Note:
Translating ‘Seu vngo lapidi iactetur…’, which
                    follows.
BodRawD328.Editions:
Meech,  Sanford Brown. 
             “A Collection of Proverbs in Rawlinson MS D 328.” 
             Modern Philology
         38 (1940-41): 113-32: 120.
